ygData.messageBody:
As far as the Shiny Brass Shield being rare...you are correct. I have one
now after watching the message rooms closely and continuosly watching
auctions in the game. I happened on someone who sold it to me for 20 plat,
good deal. I have seen people asking as much 30-40 plat. It is nice having
this shield. It puts off light like a lightstone and adds to magic
resistance as well as having 10 ac and being a magic item you can bash magic
creatures with. They are pretty rare from what I can find out. Right now I
am trying to obtain a 2h shiny brass halberd. I have seen people selling
them but haven't been able to hook up with anyone and purchase one.

Grod

-----Original Message-----
From: Mxyzptlk [mailto:hlf10@...]
Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 5:02 PM
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqpaladin] Keeping the Paladin alive


From: Mxyzptlk <hlf10@...>

To answer a few questions first:
I play on the Rathe server as a humble Dwarf Paladin named "Dauldon
Blackstone"
I was wondering about the list myself, glad to see it is still here.
I have not seen any remnants of the Elven empire in the deserts of Ro.

A question:
I am not certain how the other servers operate, however on Rathe, it seems
that a shiny brass shield is now one of the more rare items in the game. I
have seen one being sold for as high as 100 platinum (ouch). The area that
spawns the creature that occasionally has the shield, is always camped, no
matter the time of day I try. A magic shield, as you all know, is a nice
benefit to have with the bashing ability, to be able to hit creatures that
need magic to cause damage against them. Let me get to the question before
I get to far off here.
Are there other magic shields that we as Paladins can use?
If so, would you mind sharing the information. It does not have to be very
specific, just a hint or twelve <g>

Also to comment on something else I read in one of the mails...
I would have to agree with the attitude of most people when a "Holy Knight"
comes to the rescue (more often to our folly as the "rescuees" run and the
"rescuer" gets stuck with the fiends) and either lays hands or heals to the
end of mana, as being less than satisfying. I however, feel like I helped
someone, albeit most likely someone who will watch me die in the future and
not lift a finger to help. I think my chances are a bit better for someone
to help me if I help others and not watch another die while not even trying
to help. Also from a role-playing aspect, I do believe the right thing is
being done, never would a Paladin turn his head to such persons in distress.
